document.docTitle: Xiphovelia vietnamica Ye & Bu, 2016, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Xiphovelia Lundblad, 1933 and notes on Pseudovelia Hoberlandt, 1950 (Heteroptera: Veliidae) from Vietnam

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Xiphovelia Lundblad, 1933 and notes on Pseudovelia Hoberlandt, 1950 (Heteroptera: Veliidae) from Vietnam

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype : apterous male, VIETNAM , Quang Binh Prov. , Minh Hoá district, Hong Hoá (
17 ° 47 'N
,
105 ° 55 'E
),
29 .V. 2015
, coll. Zhen Ye ( NKUM ). Paratypes : 2 apterous males, 1 apterous female, same data as holotype ( NKUM ).

Diagnosis.
X. vietnamica
sp. nov.
is similar to
X. glauca
Esaki & Miyamoto, 1959
, with the connexiva in females erect and the posterior half with relatively long bristles (
Fig. 2
). However, this species can be distinguished by the relatively small body size (body length: apterous male 1.50–1.52 and apterous female 1.65 ; in
X. glauca
, body length: apterous male 1.70–1.80 and apterous female 1.90 –2.00). In males of
X. vietnamica
sp. nov.
, the metanotum has a pair of distinctly silvery hair markings (
Fig. 1
) and abdominal segment VIII (
Fig. 12
) is about 1.35 times as long as wide (in
X. glauca
, the metanotum does not have a pair of distinctly silvery hair markings and abdominal segment VIII is about 1.25 times as long as wide). In females of
X. vietnamica
sp. nov.
, the ventral surface of the legs are almost whitish.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–2. Habitus of
Xiphovelia vietnamica
sp. nov.
1. male (holotype); 2. female (paratype); Scale = 1.0 mm.

FIGURES 3–8. Habitus of
Pseudovelia
spp. (males: 3, 5, 7; females: 4, 6, 8). 3–4.
P. tibialis tibialis Esaki & Miyamoto, 1955
; 5–6.
P. vittiformis Ye, Polhemus & Bu, 2013
; 7–8.
P. intonsa Hecher, 1997
. Scale = 1.0 mm.

FIGURES 9–13. Structures of
Xiphovelia vietnamica
sp. nov.
(males). 9. fore leg, 10. middle leg, 11. hind leg; Scale = 0.1 mm. 12. abdominal segment VIII in ventral view, 13. pygophore in dorsal view; Scale = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The specific name is derived from the type locality ( Vietnam ).
